name: Cauliflower Rice Chopped Salad
author: Bibi
summary: Frozen riced cauliflower is a healthy convenience item that I like to use. I usually have some in the freezer for all kinds of side dishes. It even works in this easy, fresh, chopped salad, too. Once all your veggies are prepared, toss them in a bowl and stir up the tasty dressing, and you're done! Leave out the maple syrup, if you want to be sugar-free.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) package frozen riced cauliflower, thawed and drained
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Combine riced cauliflower, tomato, cucumber, carrots, celery, onion, cilantro, almonds, and lime zest in a large bowl
Stir together lime juice, olive oil, maple syrup, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine
